summary: This document is a case overview presented by Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss on November 5, 2020, detailing anticipated charges and investigative steps related to the Epstein case. It focuses on the charged case against Ghislaine Maxwell, the status of plea negotiations with another co-conspirator, and potential press implications from ongoing motion practice.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Presented the case overview detailing charges against Ghislaine Maxwell and investigative steps.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with conspiring to entice minors to travel for sexual abuse in connection with helping Jeffrey Epstein abuse his victims; trial set for July.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary perpetrator whose abuse of many victims Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with assisting.

connections.description: Maxwell is charged with conspiring to help Epstein abuse his victims, including participating in acts of abuse herself.
Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is overseeing the prosecution of Maxwell.

events.title: DAG Meeting Case Overview
events.description: Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss presented an overview of the Epstein case, including charges against Ghislaine Maxwell and plea negotiations with another co-conspirator.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Charged
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was charged with conspiring to entice minors to travel for sexual abuse in connection with helping Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Scheduled Motions in Maxwell Case
events.description: Motions in the Maxwell case are scheduled for December, which could generate press attention, particularly regarding the identity of victims.

events.title: Maxwell Trial Set
events.description: Trial for Ghislaine Maxwell is set for July of the coming year (2021).

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was charged in the summer of 2020 with conspiring to entice minors to travel for sexual abuse in connection with helping Jeffrey Epstein.
The case against Maxwell focuses on three specific victims who traveled to be abused by Epstein, with instances where Maxwell herself participated in the abuse.
Plea negotiations are ongoing with another Epstein co-conspirator, who scheduled hundreds of sexual massages with minors for Epstein but was also a victim of his sexual abuse.
Motion practice in the Maxwell case, scheduled for December 2020, could generate further press, particularly if Maxwell succeeds in obtaining the identity of specific victims.
